summary:
IN A NUTSHELL
I am a lawyer qualified in Germany who enjoys working in an international environment and making an impact by giving legal advice and support to businesses and colleagues so that they can accomplish their goals. | I enjoy deep-diving when it comes to legal questions and sparring with colleagues to exchange ideas and to create mutual learning opportunities | Growth mindset, interested in continuously expanding knowledge (hard skills and soft skills).

GLOBAL CITIZEN
Born and raised in Germany, lived in London, Linköping, Beijing and Shanghai, currently based in Tokyo | I am passionate about Asia - travelling, learning about the cultural characteristics and learning Mandarin Chinese and Japanese.

LANGUAGES SKILLS
Native: German | Fluent: English, Mandarin Chinese and Dutch | Studying: Japanese 

EDUCATION
Lawyer qualified in Germany, registered with the Bar Association Frankfurt am Main since 2013.
Goethe-Universität Frankfurt am Main: Specialised in public international law.
Master of Comparative Law (China University of Political Science and Law, Beijing).

HOBBIES
In my free time I love watching Chinese movies/TV-series and practicing Yoga.

school.name: China University of Political Science & Law

awards.title: Postgraduate Scholarship "Language and Professional Training in the People's Republic of China"
awards.description:
The program "Language and Professional Training in the People's Republic of China" aims at qualifying excelling German graduates as experts and managers for China. 
Up to ten graduates from certain study fields are selected every year. The program includes language courses in Mandarin at Beijing Foreign Studies University, an internship at a company or an international organization in China as well as visits to German and Chinese companies.

awards.title: Spirit of the Jessup Award
awards.description:
The Spirit of the Jessup Award was created to recognize the team that best exemplifies the Jessup spirit of comradeship, academic excellence, competitiveness, and appreciation of fellow competitors. The recipient of this award is selected by Jessup participants themselves and is intended to establish the standard to which all participants should strive to govern their performance and professional demeanor. 
The team of Frankfurt University has been awarded with the "Spirit of the Jessup Award" for the national rounds of the Moot Court competition in Germany.
awards.issuer: Participants of the Philip C. Jessup International Law Moot Court Competition

awards.title: HSK 5

company.name: Van Diepen Van der Kroef Advocaten

profile_positions.company: Van Diepen Van der Kroef Advocaten
profile_positions.description: Attorney-at-law (Rechtsanwalt) - part of the German Desk. Main focus on credit collection, commercial litigation in Germany, arbitration, as well as advising Dutch and German companies on commercial disputes in Germany and on questions of German law.
profile_positions.title: Advocaat-Medewerker

profile_positions.description: Internship as part of my DAAD scholarship program. Main focus on questions regarding Chinese inbound investment and employment law matters in China.
profile_positions.title: Intern

profile_positions.location: Frankfurt am Main und Umgebung, Deutschland
profile_positions.description:
From April 2013 to August 2014 I was an associate of the Corporate/M&A group of the Frankfurt office of Baker & McKenzie focusing on domestic and international mergers and acquisitions and general corporate advice. 
I thereby particularly handled China-related projects, such as inbound and outbound investments, M&A transactions and joint ventures involving Chinese parties. I represented national and international industrial clients and financial investors. In particular, I dealt with China-related projects, e.g. inbound and outbound investments, M&A-transactions and joint ventures.
profile_positions.title: Associate
